title: New York Dining Diary
name: New York Dining Diary
description:
A Map by Jeffroalex

A catalog of places I have dined in New York city with brief reviews and advice.  By no means is this effort comprehensive, but I hope it serves users well who are looking for eating options at all price levels in the city.

properties.name: 44 & X Hell's Kitchen
properties.description: Posted by Jeffroalex  622 Tenth Ave., New York, NY 10036An excellent white-on-white alternative to Theater District dining with creative appetizers and entrees based on re-inventing American standards. I recommend the sole with gnocchi, the turkey meatloaf, the macaroni and cheese, and the fallen chocolate souffle. Almost all of the entrees are solid. After multiple visits I am growing slightly weary of the overuse of the port wine reduction. Still one of my favorite haunts. (212) 977-1170

properties.name: @SQC
properties.description: Posted by Jeffroalex 270 Columbus Avenue, New York, NYThe large glass facade lets local patrons watch their neighbors move along Columbus Avenue. The New American food attempts bold combinations of indgredients in keeping with the ongoing fusion craze, though the results don\'t quite match the expense. Lunch might prove a better option. The restaurant does boast its kids\' menu and hot chocolate, moderately priced at , though I have sampled neither. I last ate here in November 2004. (212) 579-0100

properties.name: Carne
properties.description: Posted by Jeffroalex 2737 Broadway, New York, NYAs indicated by its name, Carne specializes in meat, and Monday is prime rib night. The interior features Texan decor and the bar always has tasty Margaritas. (212) 663-7010

properties.name: Corner Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Jeffroalex331 W 4th St, New York, NYA cozy, unpretentious dive formerly inhabitted by Bohemians but now awash in university students. The burgers are cheap, large, and brought out fast, as are the modestly priced mugs of quality beer. Beware the lenghty wait for a table during mealtimes. Skip the french fries. I ate here in April 2006. (212) 242-9502

properties.name: Docks
properties.description: Posted by Jeffroalex 2427 Broadway, New York 10024Tasty Upper West Side seafood haunt with an extensive daily selection of fresh fish. Sunday and Monday nights feature clam bakes. Presentation and sides are well-appointed though simple. I last ate here in December 2005. (212) 724-5588 Additional, larger location at 633 3rd Ave

properties.name: Henry's
properties.description: Posted by Jeffroalex2745 Broadway, New York, NYAn American bistro done in wood panels and mirrors with plenty of streetside tables. The joint is often busy but seating is usually available. The cuisine is creative and often done with continental flare. Be sure to sample the French fries. (212) 866-0600

properties.name: La Bottega
properties.description: Posted by Jeffroalex88 9th Ave. New York, nYLarge Italian kitchen with indoor and outdoor space. Excellent osso buco. I ate here in April 2006. (212) 243-8400 or (212) 835-5533

properties.name: Le Monde
properties.description: Posted by Jeffroalex2885 Broadway, New York, NYAn unpretentious French brasserie in Morningside Heights with outdoor cafe seating for sunny afternoons and a dim, cozy atmosphere for evenings. Full range of Gallic favorites done competently. For light eaters the starters are generous enough to make a meal. (212) 531-3939

properties.name: Lime Leaf
properties.description: Posted by Jeffroalex2799 Broadway, New York, NY 10025Thai cuisine done well at modest prices. Be sure to save room for the desserts. (212) 864-5000

properties.name: New Leaf Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Jeffroalex One Margaret Corbin Drive, Fort Tryon Park, new york, nyThis hidden gem nestled in Fort Tryon Park offers escape to all those tired of city noise but not city amenities. Situated in a stone house with a large, leafy patio, the cafe serves from a well-crafted menu that includes handmade pastas, a range of meats and seafood, and a number of uncooked items. Sunday brunch with one of their outstanding Bloody Marys makes an outing to the Cloisters into a fabulous day. (212) 568-5323

properties.name: Rocking Horse Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Jeffroalex 182 Eighth Avenue, new york, nY 10011A small, bustling Chelsea cafe serving Mexican cuisine with creative spirit. The Tamal de Camarones appetizer features an outstanding combination of rough polenta and creamy shrimp flavors. They also serve tasty steak and seafood entrees. I ate here in April 2006. 212.463.9511
